arguments.info: Chart ID and layout information for the charts in the dashboard

subblock.info: ID of the chart to display
The column to show the chart in (zero-based); this value always represents the leftmost column of the chart. (between 0 and 11)
How many rows the chart should take up. (greater than or equal to 1)
The row to show the chart in (zero-based); if height > 1, this value represents the topmost row of the chart. (greater than or equal to 0)
How many columns (out of a total of 12) the chart should take up. (between 1 and 12)

arguments.info: Specifies the chart data display resolution for charts in this dashboard. Value can be one of "default", "low", "high", or "highest". default by default
The ID of the dashboard group that contains the dashboard. If an ID is not provided during creation, the dashboard will be placed in a newly created dashboard group
Description of the dashboard (Optional)
(type "absolute" only) Seconds since epoch to end the visualization
Filter to apply to each chart in the dashboard

subblock.info: (false by default) Whether this filter should be a "not" filter
A metric time series dimension or property name
List of strings (which will be treated as an OR filter on the property)

arguments.info: Name of the dashboard
(type "absolute" only) Seconds since epoch to start the visualization
Whether the resource in SignalForm and SignalFx are identical or not. Used internally for syncing.
(time_span_type "relative" only) From when to display data. SignalFx time syntax (e.g. -5m, -1h)
Type of time interval of the chart. It must be "absolute" or "relative"
Dashboard variable to apply to each chart in the dashboard

subblock.info: An alias for the dashboard variable. This text will appear as the label for the dropdown field on the dashboard
Variable description
A metric time series dimension or property name
If true, this variable may only be set to the values listed in preferredSuggestions. and only these values will appear in autosuggestion menus. false by default
Determines whether a value is required for this variable (and therefore whether it will be possible to view this dashboard without this filter applied). false by default
List of strings (which will be treated as an OR filter on the property)
A list of strings of suggested values for this variable; these suggestions will receive priority when values are autosuggested for this variable

arguments.info: Description of the dashboard group
Name of the dashboard group
Whether the resource in SignalForm and SignalFx are identical or not. Used internally for syncing.

attributes.info: Description of the dashboard group
Latest timestamp the resource was updated
Name of the dashboard group
Whether the resource in SignalForm and SignalFx are identical or not. Used internally for syncing.

arguments.info: Description of the detector
Seconds since epoch. Used for visualization. You must specify time_span_type = "absolute" too.
How long (in seconds) to wait for late datapoints
Name of the detector
Signalflow program text for the detector. More info at "https://developers.signalfx.com/docs/signalflow-overview"
Set of rules used for alerting

subblock.info: Description of the rule
A detect label which matches a detect label within the program text
(default: false) When true, notifications and events will not be generated for the detect label
List of strings specifying where notifications will be sent when an incident occurs. See https://developers.signalfx.com/v2/docs/detector-model#notifications-models for more info
The severity of the rule, must be one of: Critical, Warning, Major, Minor, Info

arguments.info: (false by default) When true, markers will be drawn for each datapoint within the visualization.
Seconds since epoch. Used for visualization. You must specify time_span_type = "absolute" too.
Whether the resource in SignalForm and SignalFx are identical or not. Used internally for syncing.
(time_span_type "relative" only) From when to display data. SignalFx time syntax (e.g. -5m, -1h)
The type of time span defined for visualization. Must be either "relative" or "absolute".

attributes.info: (false by default) When true, markers will be drawn for each datapoint within the visualization.
Seconds since epoch. Used for visualization. You must specify time_span_type = "absolute" too.
Whether the resource in SignalForm and SignalFx are identical or not. Used internally for syncing.
(time_span_type "relative" only) From when to display data. SignalFx time syntax (e.g. -5m, -1h)
The type of time span defined for visualization. Must be either "relative" or "absolute".

arguments.info: Values and color for the color range. Example: colorRange : { min : 0, max : 100, color : "blue" }

subblock.info: The color range to use. Must be either "gray", "blue", "navy", "orange", "yellow", "magenta", "purple", "violet", "lilac", "green", "aquamarine"
The maximum value within the coloring range
The minimum value within the coloring range

arguments.info: Values for each color in the range. Example: { thresholds : [80, 60, 40, 20, 0], inverted : true }

subblock.info: (false by default) If false or omitted, values are red if they are above the highest specified value. If true, values are red if they are below the lowest specified value
The thresholds to set for the color range being used. Values must be in descending order

arguments.info: Description of the chart (Optional)
(false by default) If false, samples a subset of the output MTS, which improves UI performance
Properties to group by in the heatmap (in nesting order)
(false by default) Whether to show the timestamp in the chart
How long (in seconds) to wait for late datapoints
The minimum resolution (in seconds) to use for computing the underlying program
Name of the chart
Signalflow program text for the chart. More info at "https://developers.signalfx.com/docs/signalflow-overview"
The property to use when sorting the elements. Must be prepended with + for ascending or - for descending (e.g. -foo)
Whether the resource in SignalForm and SignalFx are identical or not. Used internally for syncing.
(Metric by default) Must be "Metric" or "Binary"

Label of the left axis

The minimum value for the left axis

arguments.info: (Dimension by default) Must be "Dimension" or "Metric"
Description of the chart
(false by default) If false, samples a subset of the output MTS, which improves UI performance
(type "absolute" only) Seconds since epoch to end the visualization
List of properties that shouldn't be displayed in the chart legend (i.e. dimension names)
How long (in seconds) to wait for late datapoints
The minimum resolution (in seconds) to use for computing the underlying program
Name of the chart
(LineChart by default) The default plot display style for the visualization. Must be "LineChart", "AreaChart", "ColumnChart", or "Histogram"
Signalflow program text for the chart. More info at "https://developers.signalfx.com/docs/signalflow-overview"
(false by default) Show markers (circles) for each datapoint used to draw line or area charts
(false by default) Whether vertical highlight lines should be drawn in the visualizations at times when events occurred
(false by default) Whether area and bar charts in the visualization should be stacked
(type "absolute" only) Seconds since epoch to start the visualization
Whether the resource in SignalForm and SignalFx are identical or not. Used internally for syncing.
(time_span_type "relative" only) From when to display data. SignalFx time syntax (e.g. -5m, -1h)
Type of time interval of the chart. It must be "absolute" or "relative"
(Metric by default) Must be "Metric" or "Binary"
